headline: LuvAnn's Guacamole
description: This homemade guacamole made with ripe avocados, zesty jalapeños, fresh cilantro, and tart lime juice is perfect for serving with tortilla chips or tacos.
name: LuvAnn's Guacamole
recipeIngredient: 2 medium avocados - peeled, pitted and diced

recipeInstructions.text: Mash avocados in a medium bowl. Stir in salt. Add tomato, onion, jalapeños, lime juice, and cilantro until combined.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Great the way it is !!!!!
Recipe was good. I had 4 avocados so I increased the recipe. I never add salt so That wasn't a problem I did add more lime juice and cilantro though.
Love this recipe!! I've had trouble finding a good guacamole recipe that has enough flavor. This one tasted so good with the jalapenos.
This is a wonderful guacamole, but just cut back the amount of salt.
Not a cilantro fan so did not use but was delicious without anyways!
It was picture perfect ; and tasted twice as good !
Really delicious! Only thing I changed is using lemon juice instead of the lime. This will be my go to when needed. Love it!
it's so good!! Thanks for sharing this with me. I needed more heat, so added a touch of hot salsa...now it's smokin'...ole!!!
The ingredient measurements in this recipe are way off. With the right balance of the ingredients this can be really good.

Holly guacamole, that’s a lot of salt!! I put in half and it was real salty. I used only about a 1/4 of an onion. I did use the full amount of lime and found that it was overpowering. Was this recipe intended for 6 or more avocados??
Too much salt. Yuck.
Holy SALT Batman. I went against my gut and used two teaspoons of salt and it's all I can taste. I even used four avocados.

I've make this recipe so frequently that I don't even use the exact recipe anymore, I just go by taste and memory. I tend to add more avocado and less jalapeño just due to personal preference and I don't mash the avocado, just the stirring of the ingredients partially blends it into the mix. If I'm using delectable fresh ingredients, I want to enjoy seeing them. This is delicious, definitely worth a try.
Great! Cut salt by half and I left mine a little chunky and extra cilantro and red onion, so fresh and tasty!!
Excellent, I put a little more heat in it because I like things pretty spicy.
Love it! Made a double batch for a small party it didn't last very long. Yummy!
A very good, basic guacamole. We enjoyed it.

I love this guacamole. It has everything in it that I like. Beware of salt, I put 1 teaspoon and it was probably more than it needed. Add a little at a time till its like you want. I also put less onion, about 1/3 of a red onion. I used 2 jalapeños from my garden. It turned out great!

Best recipe ever!!! I do tweak it a little, I am not a fan of big chunks so I put all the ingredients into the food processor and zip zip.... done! I also typically use serrano peppers instead of the jalapenos. I also drop in a few seeds. I also use a red onion. It has more kick that way!
Leave out most of the salt and it is very good.

This is very close to my recipe, one which has converted several guacamole haters. I add half-bunch of cilantro and a splash of white vinegar. As for the salt comments, always salt to taste. Avacado has a very narrow salt tolerance: just a little too little and it tastes bland; just a little too much and it tastes salty.
This was awesome....except....I did reduce the salt to 1 teaspoon and only added one large fresh jalapeno (seeds and ribs removed). Everyone devoured it!!!!
This was delicious. Made it exactly as directed. This is the only recipe I will use for guacamole from now on!
Very good

I did cut the salt back by about half as was recommended by other reviewers. But with that said, I got RAVE reviews on this guacamole and had no leftovers from my guests of only a small (4-6 guests) dinner party!
easy and gone in a heartbeat!

Just looking over the measurements of ingredients alerts you instantly that there is something majorly wrong with this recipe which would have nothing to do with individual taste preferences. I don't believe anyone could tolerate, let alone like, guacamole prepared with this much salt! So strike one, right off the bat. Second, for my taste buds anyway, one whole onion, two jalapenos and one large tomato to two avocados is just simply off too! Could this possibly have been for maybe SIX avocados? The lime juice, as well, is probably twice the amount it should be for this many avocados. I did make guacamole with these ingredients, but I salted *to taste* and added the other ingredients more in proportion to the two avocados. I also added a small clove of minced garlic. With significant changes in measurements this could be a great, basic guacamole. If prepared as written, however, I don't know how anyone could eat it.

I never thought I would eat guacamole, this is the best dip I have ever had. It doesn't last a day between myself and my wife. It is perfect, I usually throw in a little more salt and ball park some of the others (not measure). Still amazing.
I just used 1 tsp salt. It was easy and delicious!
We loved this, the only thing I did different, was not to mash the avacados, as we like it chuncky. I also added a large clove of garlic. Yum!

I like the mix of stuff, but based on the other reviews, I only put in a dash of salt. It seemed like way too much lime juice (and I love lime juice). I'll try it again, but I'll cut the amount of lime juice
Waaaaaay too much salt!!!
Soooo good guacamole! Substituted 1/2 cup salsa for the tomato and eliminated the salt based on other reviews.
Made exactly to recipe. Excellent! It didn't made it to refrigerator to chill for 30 mins, consumed within 30 mins. Family of four - will definately double the recipe next time!
Absolutely love this guac!! I add some fresh garlic and some cumin, but this is the only recipe I ever use for guac. Thanks LuvAnn!!!!
awesomeness
Delicious! This had a lot of taste. I used three avocados and cut back on the amount of salt. Yummmy
Best guacamole I've ever made. Followed the recipe exactly and it came out awesome.
Yum.
I'm finally reviewing this. It's great! I've made this many, many times and am just getting around to posting. This always goes over very well at every party I serve it for. thanks.
Good base, but i wish i went with my instinct and halfed the salt, way too salty, its over powering. Instead add some garlic powder and you're good!

Delicious! 1/2 the Salt, and added 2 cloves Garlic as Jillian sugested. Seeded 2 jalapenos, but we like it hot. Didn't have limes, so used Lemon juice and it tasted fine (next time I'll make sure to have limes) Thank you for a wonderful and easy Dip, just in time for Super Bowl!
So good and simple! My favorite guacamole recipe, though I add more cilantro.

Definitely reduce the salt! I put 1 tsp and that was still plenty. I'm sure the size of the avocado makes a big difference. I put 3 in since mine were pretty small. I also only used 1/2 an onion and bottled hot peppers. Good flavor. thanks

This recipe is great, however I would do like everyone else said and reduce the amount of salt. I would also reduce the amount of fresh lime juice to 1 tbsp. (instead of 2 tbsp.). 2 tbsp. was way too much lime.

I make this guacamole for almost every potluck and it is one of the first dishes to disappear. It is easy and delicious. I add a smidge less onion and a bit more cilantro just because we enjoy it that way. Would recommend this recipe for any avacado lover!
I make this all the time, but like everyone else is saying, cut the salt to about half. Onion is too much as well, I use about half. Other than that it is DELICIOUS!
I used three avocados, halved the salt, doubled the lime juice, and added an embarrassing amount of garlic. So good, I may have only had guacamole and chips for dinner last night...

Wonderful guacamole, but do cut the amount of salt in half at least! I also cut the amount of jalepeno in half as well and when it states one onion diced I used only 2 Tbsp. of finely chopped red onion. I de-seeded the tomato (used 1 roma) and added 1/4 tsp. of cumin and 2 cloves of minced garlic from a jar. Overall, pretty good with warm tortilla chips.
Cut the salt!! I would recommend 1/2 tsp. instead of 2 tsp. Other than that, it's a good recipe. That much salt ruins it.

OMG! I LOVE this recipe and make it all the time. Everyone loves it. I love how there isn't any sour cream added, but that there is lots of garlic and cilantro! Always a hit! I put it in my 7 layer taco dip and it truly transforms the entire dip!
Absolutley wonderful!
Love all the ingredients in this recipe!! Even those who don't love avocado loved this guac.

good recipe but needs some tweeking. I would definitely add a couple cloves of fresh minced garlic and cut salt down to 1/4 teaspoon. Be sure to use plum(roma) tomatoes because they have less juice. Also, if you plan on making this ahead of time (no more that 24 hours), I find it's best to add the tomatoes right before serving. I find the juice causes the guacamole to brown faster...even with the lime juice.
five stars!!!!!! absolutely authentic and to die for, my thirteen year old won't eat avocado or guacamole, but her whole hand is in the bowl as we speak. good job!

I also wish that I had read the reviews prior to making this recipe. It was way too salty and needed an extra avocado due to the amount of the other ingredients. Otherwise, it was one of the best gaucamole recipes I have found. And do make sure you remove the seeds from the jalapeno peppers unless that is the way you like it. I will definitely make this again.
the salt ruined this recipe couldnt even eat it
Added garlic salt and used lemon juice. Very good.

Almost perfect guacamole! Ok, so I used less salt & added a clove of minced garlic, but that's just b/c we love garlic! I think it would still be great guacamole as written. This list of ingredients (plus garlic) is what I think of when I think good old fashioned guacamole. The basics are here, so just adjust the amount of each ingredient until it suits your taste. Thanks for the starter recipe! :)
made this many times

Awesome! Halved the recipe to use in a small 7-layer dip. Only complaint was DH whining, "Did you have to use ALL the guacamole in the dip?" Had to make another batch just for him once the rest of the avacados were ripe. Thanks LuvAnn!!
Great Guacamole - just wish I had read the other reviews first and adjusted the salt down a bit. Other than that a keeper!

I subbed out the salt for 1 tsp of garlic salt. I also thought 1 whole onion was too much. Afterwards I mixed 2 parts avacado dip with 1 part salsa and 1/2 cup of mozza and baked it @ 400 for 10 - 15min. No need to cool this way, and it's always been really popular dish.
Love guacamole. I have made this recipe several times before becoming a member of allrecipes. I used this recipe for my sister's baby shower, turned out great. Always a pleaser!!!

I doubled with some variations: -4 avacados -1/2 t. salt -1 can diced tomatoes w/ green chiles (drained) -1 red onion -~8 jalapeno rings chopped (from jar) -~2T cilantro -3 T lime juice (used 4T and was a little too limey) -1 t. minced garlic

Very yummy. I was looking for a recipe like this since a had guacamole a a friends place that was similar. I would only try using less salt next time. I try not to use much salt and found it a little salty.
Great! I also add a dash of hot sauce and freshly chopped basil. Adds more of a kick.
My guacamole was ruined!! The salt measurement on here MUST be wrong. I even used 4 avocados and the recommended amount of salt and it was way too salty still!
When I can find fresh tomatoes and avacados, I always make this! Very fresh tasting guac, my favorite!
Awesome.
I served this on a salsa and hummus appetizer platter at my sons first birthday and got rave revues!! I've already forwarded the recipe on to several of my friends and family.
I use about 1tbsp of juice from a lime or lemon, whichever I have on hand. I also learn a trick from mexico to put the seed of 1 avacado in the bowl to keep it from turning brown as fast.
AWESOME. I skipped the cilantro...I hate cilantro...and added 3 cloves of garlic and threw everything in the food processor.

Way too salty! Please read this before you make it because I wish I would have. What a waste of 3 avocados. I had to add one more avocado to this and it was still too salty. This is absolutely inedible.
Due to morning sickness, took out the peppers, but it was still great.
I love this recipe , but definitely cut down on the salt-even less than half.I also cut down on the jalapeno and used a small onion.

Too salty and too spicy. Next time, I will cut down the amount of salt and jalapeno by half. I also suggest adding come garlic. Maybe grind it up in a mortar with the salt so there won't be any garlic chunks. This is a good recipe to start with but I won't be making it again.

WOW! I really don't like guacamole, but decided to give it a whirl. This is absolutely delicious. I did cut down on the jalapenos, just because I'm a wimp when it comes to hot foods and used half the salt. It's a definite keeper in my house.
This is the best guacamole I have ever eaten!!!
After reading the reviews I decided to use 1/2 teas. salt, some crushed fresh garlic..and then then followed the rest of the recipe.. One of the best gaucamole's I ever made..
Did not love this recipe, turned out way too salty!

I loved this recipe though I did alter it. I added garlic salt, a squirt of lemon and just a little picante sauce. I also used fresh pico de gallo that I bought prepackaged instead of adding the onion, cilantro, lime juice and jalapanos separately.
Awesome. So fresh. Used less salt, more lime juice and fresh oregano. Food processed, then spread on top of home-made buffalo burritos. Droollllllllllllllll.
Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!
This is a great recipe for guacamole. I really enjoyed it and will make it again.
Very good when made with 1/2 tsp salt and one clove chopped garlic.
I didn't measure the salt, just added it to taste (which is what you really should do in recipes like this). It was amazing. We ate this all up while waiting for the enchiladas to get done
This is an OK starter recipe but it's missing a lot of flavor. I added salt to taste but it's still bland.
This recipe had way too much salt. Absolutely surprised it had such a high rating.
a 4 with a lot less salt....but a good guacamole, just lay off the salt
This was great... like someone else said it was a bit salty! I added fresh mangos just for something different, the flavors blended well with eachother, I got a lot of compliments!
I made a double batch for a party and couldn't stop eating it. I kept a bowl of this home for myself. Yummy!

My only suggestion - mix everything together except the avocado, mix it in last, and you will avoid serving guac that is all mushy, wet, and ucky. Small dice the tomato and onion, medium dice the avocado since it's the star.
Great guacamole! I cut back on the salt and added some freshly minced cloves of garlic. Very flavorful!

Very delicious. I made this early in the day and let it sit in the frigde so that the flavors could meld together. A tip from this site suggests to leave the avocado pit inside the bowl while you are chilling your guacamole. That way it doesn't turn brown and ugly. Will make again but maybe make it even hotter. I cut back on the jalapeno because I was serving it to small kids as well. Thanks !

This was really tasty guacamole. I loved this but my hubby prefers other recipes. I used 3 small avocados and 3/4 tsp. garlic salt. I thought this was great on a bed of shredded lettuce with a dollop of sour cream and served with tortilla chips. I gave it a 5 after cutting the salt. Thanks, I thought this one was worth repeating.
This is my favorite guacamole recipe. I make this, but I leave out the pepper. This has a great, rich flavor.
I have made this guacamole several times and everyone loves it. It's addicting. People stand around the bowl eating it until it's gone. I do recommend cutting down the salt and using a red onion.
Cut the salt in half and it was divine!
